page.title: 17Teenage life in Braydon
page.content: An interview with a 19 year old from Braydon revealed that he was born in Braydon and educated in Purton. He was employed on a farm and enjoyed his work, In the winter his working day started at 6am and finished at 6.30pm. In the summer he worked until dusk if needed. His social time was linked with the Young Farmers programme of activities. He also enjoyed watching films on TV or on video and listening to pop music (particularly the independant stations). Traditional English foods were his favourites, for example roast beef and yorkshire pudding with vegetables. His breakfast consisted of a bowl of cereal. He was very contented with his life and preferred his own fairly isolated home to living in a town or village.
